üö®SlowMist Security Alertüö®

We detected potential suspicious activity related to 0xb5486f71c902fe0844bb07221fa8f47834d90b1b. 
The contract was upgraded to an implementation contract containing a backdoor function 'transferTokens'. Attackers used this function to steal assets https://t.co/339eIVBZR1
OWASP Smart Contract Top 10: 2025 https://t.co/f6DYtHnPyE

üö®SlowMist Security Alertüö®

We have detected that @zothdotio has been exploited, likely due to a leakage of Admin privileges, resulting in the logic contract being tampered with and replaced by a malicious contract.

Btw, thanks to @0xtroll for the shout-out.

As always, stay https://t.co/nQfHPYT2OV

https://t.co/nYnHj839gV. GFA token exploited. What an awful developer! There's a contract for calculating reward-0xbcbcb0e7e28414e084c4a40c1ccc30b75629a7de, but no access check in that contract. Hacker could manually generate reward and drained pancake pair using that tokens. https://t.co/RWII2T21fD
Because of this one line of code, $1.3m hacked. How terrible! https://t.co/eoZZhBKha3 https://t.co/1kQQHuZc8R
Scammers are very clever. Be careful when you approve you tokens. Before you approve, check target address and approve once you can trust that address.
Another similar hacking. https://t.co/CVqMe7dVvJ.

üòàAttackers can exploit this flaw by crafting specific inputs to extract private keys with just a single signature, potentially compromising digital assets or
https://t.co/2ZyO1kOhpj.

Unverified contracts were hacked on multiple chains because of access check. Those contracts have functions(like "0xa6efca62") that can be used for swap tokens on uniswap v3, and there're no access check in those functions. Hacker created fake uniswap v3 pool with his own token https://t.co/PrLiFuliju

I‚Äôve got some important info about the Thala hack that got $25M stolen. There‚Äôs a lot that doesn‚Äôt add up, and I think it‚Äôs something the community should be aware of. Here is detail.
https://t.co/SZ4YqIVTFk

ALERT! Our system has detected hundreds of suspicious transactions targeting @InfernoBullWin since 09/11/2024. This appears to be a typical case of forced investment. While the average loss per transaction is only $1.5K, the total loss has reached ~$440K. 

As there is no direct https://t.co/CeZsdbSk7F

https://t.co/h1ng3rFEDZ
HFLH exploit. Root cause is in price calcualtion. As you can see, price is calculated by amount of tokens in LP, but this can be maniupulated easily. Hacker could manipulate this price by transfering tokens into LP,after that he used "skim" to get tokens. https://t.co/LtLEpa1YAC

Yeah, this is hacking. https://t.co/LNxLjN6prd. When tokens are transferred to pancake pair, it exchanges its own tokens to USDT and transfer to LPDividendTracker contract. USDT in that contract can be distributed. Hacker created a lot of contracts and exploited this. https://t.co/r8FGX0t8xA

üö®ALERTüö®@RhoMarketsHQ has announced that they have detected unusual activity on their platform on #Scroll chain  and paused the platform!

Root cause of this incident seems to be an oracle access control by a malicious actor!

Affected pools are $USDC, $USDT.  Currently,

Tx example: https://t.co/DxMz1oQTZI.
There's a callback function for uniswap v3 exchange in victim contract, and it didn't check msg.sender. So hacker could call this function directly, transferred funds of users who approved to victim contract. https://t.co/iEnOkrvsxt

function. After that he exchanged all LAURA to WETH, as x*y=k got much smaller, he was able to gain much more WETH. Total loss is $48k.
https://t.co/IwzXKrpDbZ
https://t.co/KV7moqV1t7 https://t.co/aybjWvm1g9

https://t.co/D8TknQ3E5S
Maybe private key compromised.
contract approve tokens to paraswap router, and then moved those tokens to himself. If you want more detail, dm me or ask in group. https://t.co/ebwVrM0ute
large amount of tokens, withdraw much more tokens than he staked. I have warned not to use "getReserves" for price calcualtion several times, can't understand awful developers.
https://t.co/1p6HnZdwx0. Reentrancy attack! There's no reenctrance check in code. https://t.co/omA3FNuVMp

and locked amount is decreased after "_feeHandler()" is called. This can be used for reentrancy attack. Hacker was able to call "withdrawLock()" function and get locked tokens as locked amount is not decreased when function is called. Total loss is about $16k. Developers need to https://t.co/BLTyskhfJ4

Oh, @HegicOptions hacked? Victim contract has "withdrawWithoutHegic" function that withdraws user fund. Unfortunately, developer forgot to reduce "t.share" value, user can withdraw multiple times. Hacker just called withdraw function multiple times, drained all fund in victim https://t.co/0xPMH1oXOv

generated lots of account(ex:https://t.co/iDZD0P8NHm), owned LP tokens, thereby got distributed USDT. Then gathered those tokens like this tx:https://t.co/lECPGUQPd0. If you want to know more detail, contact me. https://t.co/BD3KwAibHY

Is this private key leak or rug pull? 
Also, hacker is moving tokens of users who approved to lending pool, revoke approval asap.
https://t.co/FvZr8UzEaB
https://t.co/9bvL9ljoC7
https://t.co/xyT880BDcX https://t.co/Giz6FHGB69

this hacker could do sandwich attack. Then how did he involved in "premarket_user" list? Root cause of this attack is if transfer amount is the same as balance of teamWalletAddress, the address is included in that list. https://t.co/rb1gzoXCPf

and let victim contract exchange tokens on that pool by calling vulnerable function, then removed liquidity from pool. Contracts on Ethereum, Bsc, Avalanche and Base were affected, total loss is $170k.
https://t.co/GW7uM75Ogk
https://t.co/PayOAZqrLY https://t.co/NMyhw1b39Q
LP, that's why BOO price was very high, he was able to deposit 1 BOO and drain all pools. Total loss is over $7m. https://t.co/sNB2yGWYI7

in each "removeLiquidity" function, he gets more and more bnbs tokens, as bnbs balance is not updated. After that, he exchanged all bnbs tokens to WBNB, total loss is about $20k.
https://t.co/i5iiBvLydT
https://t.co/yrTYkR8Dg4

It seems that X-413 token hacked. Hacking was processed in several step. When transferring tokens to uniswap pair, X-413 token exchanges tokens in its contract into USDT and send them to nftRouter and lpRouter. These USDT tokens can be distributed according to LP amount. Hacker https://t.co/fxjsfa22Mr

https://t.co/7Jrt5IYvXm
DDONALD token rug pull.
It's because of wrong price calculation. Also, to call "_Start" function, hacker transferred 950000 USDT to pool. https://t.co/N736TQSkp4
@Bankroll_Status lost $230k.

No, hacker gained only about $45k. This hacking was done in 2 steps. First tx:https://t.co/8lMI0Micos. In this tx, he called "placeSellOrder" function, in that function, WILL tokens are swapped to USDT and swap amount depends on order size. After this, he exchanged some USDT to https://t.co/MuhKY34Dfp

üö®SlowMist Security Alertüö®

The lending project @zkLend on the Starknet chain was attacked today, with more than $9 million in assets lost!
 
The SlowMist security team found that the core reason for this attack lies in the safeMath library adopted by the market contract. When https://t.co/S3P73E4uxu

sandwich attack. Hacker swapped large amount of WBNB to EGA, called vulnerable function, and then swapped EGA to WBNB, gained 506 WBNB for free.
https://t.co/Csa6ma0x3N https://t.co/OX0JizPzND
@OnyxProtocol hacked, lost about $4m.
Phalcon supports almost all EVM chains, very useful tool!

4 similar tokens-TAGAIFUN, GROK, PEPE, TEST were exploited due to wrong price calculation. 11BNB lost.
https://t.co/76joDnbfcX

Right, it's classic price manipulation. It has SUI market and price of SUI is calculated using CLPool(Uniswap v3 fork) status. The pool is very small and easy to manipulate. As you can see price is very much higher after manipulation. https://t.co/9OaXxLo1s6 https://t.co/icJLGcKAma
I created a telegram group for convenience. Anyone who wants my help, join my group and ask me. https://t.co/1hOreGbeo1
Lol, DN404 hacker gained 0.004 eth by calling a normal function. https://t.co/N7JmcVZkbq

https://t.co/ZOFN3kRKZi. There's "claimMultipleStaking" function in victim contract. It calculates claimable amount from several cvx staking contracts and mint that amount of tokens. But it didn't check input parameter, so hacker could use his own contract as cvx staking to

the increased value is ignored. This means anyone can get reward several times using different token Ids. As you can see, before getting reward, hacker deposited as much tokens as reward pool has. After that, hacker called "getPeriodReward" function twice for each pool using https://t.co/h9jUbik9zM
Yeah, hacker changed admin and then upgraded proxy. https://t.co/VYIhgDC9nE

tokens to pair and calling "skim" of pair. As you can see, if dest address is pair, it burns tokens at the pair. In the end, UPS reserve was very small, and hacker could drain BUSD in pair using a few UPS tokens. https://t.co/pdP4LTsDYN

https://t.co/NbOTURNLgO
iVest token hacking. In "transfer" function, if to address is 0x0, balance of sender is reduced 2 times, wrong logic. Hacker transferred some iVest tokens to uniswap pair, called skim(0x0), sync(). Because of wrong transfer, balance of pair was very small https://t.co/ubb8RfDrth
Why did he transfer all LP tokens into pair? Didn't know it can be burnt by anyone? https://t.co/RasFOzXIhV

be care of reentrance.
https://t.co/a0fo5ABOH6
https://t.co/2qeQX8iDQW

https://t.co/nNMqdBFuYH
@1inch related incident. There have been multiple hacking transactions due to a bug in 1inch contracts. Stay vigilant, will provide detail soon...

https://t.co/vZgCZVXvGr.
Oh, UPS token exploited again?

reward several times. Hacker just called "withdraw(1 wei)" multiple times, gained almost $43k.
https://t.co/4LxsrXVDvh
https://t.co/F4HbgBsZtA https://t.co/Pyb6WCauMA

@PeapodsFinance hacked due to improper access check. Peapods reward contract was drained by sandwich attack.
"depositFromPairedLpToken" function of reward contract exchanges all pOHM token to PEAS token. It has "_slippageOverride" parameter, hacker was able to do sandwich https://t.co/9RA3pO8Xlt
again using "sell" function. Root cause is the same as STM token exploit, wrong calculation of liquidity amount to remove in "sell" function.

different token Ids, could drain all reward pools. "veWithdrawnTokenAmountByPeriod" shoudn't consider "tokenId".
https://t.co/g9qFdHmnSI
https://t.co/SnYyh7RT90 https://t.co/v7sUUBuzsA

ALERT! Our system has detected some suspicious transactions targeting on an unknown contract on #BSC and a contract of @PlayEmberSword on #Polygon , resulting in a loss of $240K. Please revoke any approvals to 0x389a9ae29fbe53cca7bc8b7a4d9d0a04078e1c24 on #BSC and https://t.co/yTARRneDZz
https://t.co/qD0DJIBURS

Oh, call injection! Long time no seen. "swap" function didn't check call target and call data. Because of this, users who approved to 0x1231deb6f5749ef6ce6943a275a1d3e7486f4eae lost their tokens, revoke approval asap! Also, Lifi router set this implementation recently. Implement https://t.co/bgT4eAQUUH
Damn, I can't log in to @dedaub decompiler.
Wow, even chatgpt?

STM token exploited. https://t.co/oQqhQBPoRA. There's "sell" function in "MineSTM" contract, and it uses reserve of pair for liquidity calculation. Hacker manipulated reserve amount by swapping large amount of tokens, and then called "sell" function to get lots of tokens. https://t.co/Om8N1gGZ8r
Total loss is about $100k. https://t.co/EmSOTjzAY9

BGM token has "withdraw" function that manipulates pancake swap pair reserve. Hacker exchanged large amount of USDT to BGM token, leveraged "withdraw" function to manipulate pair state, then exchanged BGM to USDT again. https://t.co/KKVxvO5IlF https://t.co/UxKOWJOATj
When implementing callback function, you should check calldata and msg.sender correctly.

https://t.co/XdzNtipvjj. An unverified contract lost $4k. I think root cause is improper check of calldata in "uniswapV2Call" function. It needs to check first parameter-sender address, but it didn't. Hacker could call this callback function by calling "swap" function. https://t.co/J0fABHulor

https://t.co/m4wWKABXE7. This is typical compound v2 fork lending market attack. I warned not to make an empty market before. They made an Velo market, but it was empty, so hacker was able to exploit round down error. I advise Lending market owners again. Don't make an empty
Which lending project do users like better? Aave or Compound?

Oh, no, who made this router?
https://t.co/lx9dOufmbu. "transferFee" function has really basic vulnerability. https://t.co/0CK8iHwJw6
It's not a good idea to get price from DEX projects, I think.

https://t.co/BpAOfKjtwK
Oh, if "_fixedPriceEnabled" is true, "x*y>=k" is ignored. Also, anyone can modify this value. Before hack, it was set to true, and just after hack, it was set to false. https://t.co/ujorSgPeHu

remaining if pool had very large liquidity. Hacker deposited a huge amount of USDC(60M) to lending pool and borrowed some stEth, and then withdraw all USDC, gained 60 stEth for free. Health factor should be checked after token transfer. Also, "getShareByValue" should use "divUp" https://t.co/3sFVE0Cxtb

Hacker could borrow all assets of Uwu pool using uSUSDE tokens he gained in previous attack. @UwU_Lend , why didn't you stop supporting SUSDE token for collateral? Didn't know that there're remaining uSUSDE tokens in hacker's address?

Very very classic oracle issue. As you can see from picture, BOO token price is very high. Why? BOO token price is calculated using Spooky LP token state. This can be easily manipulated using flashloan. At the beginning of the attack, hacker borrowed almost all BOO tokens from https://t.co/kdSJilOdZr

wkeyDao token hacked. Hacker repeatedly bought wkeyDao token at a low price from unverified contract and then sold them on Dex, cycling through this process multiple times. $730k was lost because of this simple exploit. ü§Ø
https://t.co/HHFLIm5V8M
https://t.co/AMvq0gIpwg https://t.co/OP2mKmelQG

SPythia lost 21 ETH. https://t.co/hTP7nVezzC. Anyone who holds SPythia token can call "claimRewards" function without any locking period. Hacker could call "claimRewards" function several times by moving tokens from one account to another account. Reward amout should be

I've studied and analyzed all blockchain hacking transactions for 2 years. Now I can analyze hacking tx faster than even security teams like @peckshield or @CertiK. If you have problem when analyzing tx, don't hesitate to ask me. My email : NickLFranklin@outlook.com

Yesterday, #Bybit and #Safe released their official reports on the $1.5 billion crypto theft.

‚ö†Ô∏èThis incident highlights how hackers are compromising development environments and supply chains with precision‚Äîreinforcing the critical need for strict frontend code control.

‚úçÔ∏èThe https://t.co/jKf3dzAyEl
I think loss due to exploit is decreasing. Good!

Maybe private key leak or rug pull. There's a function that burns token in pair and it can be called by only authorized signer. Hacker called "burnToken" function several times, manipulated pair reserve, drained pair. https://t.co/sdONYxJadA

UPS token exploited. https://t.co/9wqVx7dgUs. UPS token has an awful transfer implementation. When transferring tokens to pancake pair, it burns tokens at the pair, and calls "sync" function. Using that hacker could reduce UPS reserve of pancake pair. He repeated transferring https://t.co/GBU65DF4ll

BIZNESS on base was hacked, root cause is reentrancy. Locker contract has "splitLock" function that splits lock position. In this function, "_feeHandler()" function is used for sending fees to treasury and remaining to user. There's no reentrancy check in "splitLock" function, https://t.co/87edCxTpHo
If "x*y>=k" is ignored, anyone can drain pair! :(((
I decided to launch my own Defi, what kind of Defi will be the best? DEX, Lending or Staking? If anyone has good opinion, please send me message.
Maybe private key leak or rug pull.

Labubu token was hacked because of wrong transfer logic. If sender and recipient are the same...? Anyone can increase token balance by just sending token to itself. $120k was drained because of this simple vulnerability. :(
https://t.co/V9j5yhBJXi
https://t.co/eM2H7sRwd9 https://t.co/WAYjTeOfX8

. @dehub_official on BSC was hacked with a public signer vulnerability, with around 5K loss. 

https://t.co/E2o6O4KERT https://t.co/831lHs3Udw

https://t.co/9FfHROBARz. So many token exploits. SATX token exploited again. In "transfer" function, if from address is uniswapV2Pair, SATX tokens are transferred to "_tokenOwner" address when USDT balance and reserve is the same. Because of this, in "skim" function, much more https://t.co/XNRUSEGPtt

An unverified contract on Base was exploited, root cause is improper input check. It seems that this function is used for token exchange, but as there's no check about input for external call, this can be used for call injection. Hacker took fund from users who approved to this https://t.co/3o34hfRGF1

Awful token. How is it possible to transfer tokens in pair?
https://t.co/ipnVt4YrFw. Who made this token?
Developers, be careful when implementing callback functions!
https://t.co/TXnYEmD3MR

bnbs token exploit. Root cause of bnbs exploit is reentrance. "removeLiquidity" function has  no reentrance check, and bnbs balance is updated after eth sent, this  can be used for reentrance attack. As you can see, "removeLiquidity" function is called in fallback function, and https://t.co/4v4CwjqG9n
In my opinion, this is private key leak.
https://t.co/P20SkY7lI6, Burner contract drained because of sandwich attack.

This function can be called by anyone. It transfers tokens to specific address configured by 0xd3bc1728. @PikeFinance , I want you to give me source code so that I can explain more detail. https://t.co/9ULcNGTmMb
Arbitrage again. https://t.co/rQ57MkmcQh

he transferred some BOLT to pancake pair and called "skim", repeated this step multiple times. BOLT balance of pancake pair was much smaller than normal, hacker was able to drain all USDT in pancake pair by selling BOLT tokens.

https://t.co/Cma69B4Qaw https://t.co/A7KofNyk6N

attack by setting this value to 999. Total loss is $3.5k.

Sorra staking contract was hacked because of wrong reward calculation. When user withdraws his tokens, they get reward. This is arbitrage, not hacking. https://t.co/WQEYVb0HK1.
As you can see, price of USDT at pancake pair is much higher than BigBang pair. He couldn't call swap function of BigBangSwap because unlike other uniswap v2 fork projects, swap function can't be called by anone, checks https://t.co/2KsYeil87E

WILL tokens. Because of first exchange, he got some more WILL tokens. Second tx:https://t.co/lcOnEP56HM. He called "settleExpiredPositions" function. It exchanged all expired tokens(USDT) to WILL. In first step, he created with margin = 0, so that order was alos expired from https://t.co/32KfxEhoak

Very good!

anyone can withdraw tokens several times if USDT or USDC balance is not 0 and rewardQueue is not empty.
To increase USDC balance, hacker called "buy" function, and called "join" function before "exitProgram" to push into rewardQueue. He repeated this step multiple times, gained https://t.co/Ho0V5mOxdc
to do necessary initialization in constructor.

calculated using locked period.
I decompiled victim contract. I really can't understand why developer made such vulnerable function without any access check. This is really easy vulnerability to find. https://t.co/BDYA6saa9D

#CertiKInsight üö®

We have detected a flashloan exploit on Slurpycoin on BSC. The attacker exploited the buyback mechanism to manipulate the token price and profited ~$3K from sandwich arbitrage.

This attack is also responsible for the ~$10K exploit on the MRP token on Jul-02. https://t.co/E5oE1Y10NN
https://t.co/q4UBVw3DD7. Victim contract doesn't check if msg.sender is valid in "uniswapV3Callback" function. https://t.co/eQ5Kj17Wb0

Get ready, it‚Äôs about to go down. 

Big love to @0xNickLFranklin for stepping up for the Remedy CTF 2025.

Ready to take part?

Sign up here üëá https://t.co/Toic1bGRd5
There's no access check in uniswapV3SwapCallback function. https://t.co/T0bbk32HMI

An old, unverified contract hacked. https://t.co/s9aAcN40Ys. Root cause is improper parameter check. Normal action of this contract is like this picture, swap using balancer, and then using uniswap. Because of no parameter check, hacker could let victim contract approve tokens https://t.co/uMUQyrXrcq

Decentralized Finance(DCF) hacked. Victim contract has exchange functionality, but it gets exchange rate using pancakeswap v2 pair. This can be easily manipulated by exchanging huge amount of tokens on pancake swap. Hacker exchanged almost all DCF token in victim contract to https://t.co/FOcsxwHUR2

#CertiKInsight üö®

We saw an exploit on the IPC token deployed 7 days ago. 

The attacker circumvented the flashloan protection mechanism and exploited the deflationary mechanism that burns tokens on the pair to drain the victim pair of ~$590K. https://t.co/fg4c6IuXK0

transfer logic, it should be audited.

AIZPT token hacked. https://t.co/S9y1k0QFSp
Root cause is wrong price calculation. If someone buys a huge amount of tokens with a lot of BNB, then he can sell tokens at high price, he can send few tokens and get much BNB. Hacker bought 8000 BNB worth AIZPT token, and then sold https://t.co/dhDvwzTHw2

cash was different. Using this hacker could drain all tokens in the pool. There was another similar attack about 1 year ago-@ElasticSwap hacking. This was also hacked due to inconsistencies of balance and cash. https://t.co/lHt2HWG11a. burn function should be like this. https://t.co/M9Crykj07i

all ETH in XSD/ETH pair. This project was attacked on several chains, total loss is $45k.

NGFS token hacking. https://t.co/BGGz16eD34. Hacker could increase his balance using "reserveMultiSync" function. This is because contract was not initialized after deployment. "delegateCallReserves" can be called only once, but deployer didn't call this. I recommend deployers https://t.co/cpJswFntCg

https://t.co/M85ttJ0xfM. Oh, how did hacker transfer LW tokens from LW contract? When did LW contract approve to hacker contract? I think it's not because of approve, root cause is underflow. As you can see, compiler version is 0.76 and "transferFrom" doesn't check underflow. https://t.co/jvIjx7usPI

In victim contract, there're functions for swapping old token to new token and vice versa. In "sellSwappedTokens" function, it swaps old tokens to new tokens using pancakeswap, hacker could sandwich this exchange, and gained $87k. https://t.co/28VGLkf3p1
Very good! Perfect tool! I love Phalcon!
